title: Daily Activities
question: Can Martha feed herself without assistance or does she need help during meal times?

title: Daily Activities
question: I see. Moving on, when it comes to dressing, can Martha put on her clothes without any assistance? Or does she struggle with certain aspects like buttons, zippers, or shoe laces?

title: Daily Activities
question: Thank you for sharing. Now, regarding toileting, can Martha use the toilet independently, or does she require some assistance for certain parts, like cleaning or flushing?

title: Daily Activities
question: Thank you for being patient with these questions. When it comes to personal hygiene, can Martha brush her teeth, comb her hair, and wash her face and hands without assistance?

title: Daily Activities
question: Okay, and for bathing, is Martha able to bathe herself without any help? Or does she need assistance with some parts, like washing her back or feet?

title: Mobility
question: Got it. How about transferring? Is Martha able to move in and out of her bed or chair on her own? Or does she need some help or an assistive device for that?

title: Mobility
question: How would you rate Martha’s ability to walk a block or climb a flight of stairs or more?

title: Cognition
question: Has Martha experienced any difficulties with memory, attention, or problem-solving that affected daily life?

title: Cognition
question: Thank you. Has Martha exhibited difficulties in recognizing their environment or wandered away from home lately?

title: Cognition
question: And has Martha faced difficulties remembering date and month or familiar faces?

title: Mind
question: Has Martha felt agitated, anxious, irritable, or depressed?

title: Mind
question: Thank you for answering. From late afternoon till night, has Martha shown increased confusion, disorientation, restlessness, or difficulty sleeping?

title: Independence (IADL)
question: Thanks for that. Now, let's move on to some instrumental activities. Can Martha prepare and cook meals by herself? Or does she require help with certain dishes or prefer pre-prepared meals?

title: Independence (IADL)
question: Understood. When it comes to her medications, can Martha manage and take them correctly without supervision? Or does she sometimes forget and need reminders?

title: Independence (IADL)
question: Alright. How about money management? Can she handle her finances, pay bills, and manage money without assistance?

title: Independence (IADL)
question: Thanks for sharing. Does Martha still use the phone? Is she able to make and answer calls independently?

title: Independence (IADL)
question: Got it. Regarding housekeeping, can Martha manage household chores on her own, or does she require some assistance?

title: Independence (IADL)
question: Thank you. When it comes to shopping, can Martha shop for groceries and necessities independently? Or does she need some help or prefer to make only small purchases?

title: Independence (IADL)
question: And concerning transportation, is Martha still driving or using public transport by herself? Or does she require assistance or uses pre-arranged transportation?

title: Social
question: Now, thinking about Martha’s social activity. Has Martha had any difficulty interacting with relatives or friends or participating in community or social activities?

title: Social
question: How frequently does Martha engage in social activities or maintain relationships?
